In my RCP application I use org.eclipse.update.scheduler plugin to perform
automatic checks for updates. If the platform is shutdown before the check is
over, the following error appears in the log file:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 2 2005-06-11 11:25:02.122
!MESSAGE Job found still running after platform shutdown.  Jobs should be
canceled by the plugin that scheduled them during shutdown:
org.eclipse.update.internal.scheduler.AutomaticUpdateJob
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
org/eclipse/update/operations/IInstallFeatureOperation
	at org.eclipse.update.ui.UpdateJob.getUpdates(UpdateJob.java:205)
	at
org.eclipse.update.internal.scheduler.UpdateJobChangeAdapter.done(UpdateJobChangeAdapter.java:35)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobListeners$3.notify(JobListeners.java:39)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobListeners.doNotify(JobListeners.java:96)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobListeners.done(JobListeners.java:158)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.endJob(JobManager.java:477)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.WorkerPool.endJob(WorkerPool.java:94)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:83)

Also I did another test: in the Eclipse itself (automatic updates disabled) I
started the search for updates, moved it into background, then exit Eclipse.
Again I got similar warning in the log file (this time without any exception):

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 2 2005-06-11 11:36:45.93
!MESSAGE Job found still running after platform shutdown.  Jobs should be
canceled by the plugin that scheduled them during shutdown:
org.eclipse.update.ui.UpdateJob
